text: VETS30031 / VETS90123 Animals in Extensive Production Systems Challenges for the dairy industry – political and social Megan Thomas megan.thomas@unimelb.edu.au Political challenges – trade 23 Social licence to operate – live animal export 4 Social licence to operate – public perception of management practices/ animal welfare 5 Dairy Australia Social licence to operate – antimicrobial stewardship 6 Dairy Australia Social licence to operate – environmental impact / sustainability 7 “The Australian Dairy Industry contributes around 12% of all greenhouse gas emissions from agriculture in Australia. Although this is only 2 to 3 % of national greenhouse gas emissions, the dairy industry is the largest source of both methane (40%) and nitrous oxide (47%) in south eastern Australia”. Source: Prof. Richard Eckart, University of Melbourne AEPS – DAIRY WEEK 2 8
